thread.title: BOJ's Kuroda warns inflation expectations may not rise smoothly

title: BOJ's Kuroda warns inflation expectations may not rise smoothly
text:
May 10, 2018 / 3:30 AM / Updated 20 minutes ago BOJ's Kuroda warns inflation expectations may not rise smoothly Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
TOKYO (Reuters) - Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda on Thursday warned of risks that could delay achievement of the central bank’s price target, such as the chance inflation expectations may not heighten as smoothly as projected. Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda attends a news conference in Tokyo, Japan, April 9, 2018. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon
“If there is strong uncertainty about future growth, firms will hesitate to raise wages,” Kuroda said in a speech. “Even if firms’ wage- and price-setting stance becomes more proactive, inflation expectations may not rise smoothly.” Reporting by Leika Kihara and Stanley White; Editing by Chris Gallagher
